title: Without Qualification, One Cannot Become a Guru | HDG Srila Prabhupada | Bg 2.2 | 12.08.2024
speaker: HDG Srila Prabhupada

आनि मंतदवित है उस यह सरकमें हैं जो जब जिंदीय व्यक्ति-ज़ंदि कांधार प्रभाविय का ऑस jusquूं वितना है
of life they do not lead to higher planets but to infamy report by shila Prabhupada Krishna and the
Supreme Personality of Godhead are identical therefore Lord Krishna is referred to as Bhagawan
throughout the Gita Bhagawan is the ultimate in the Absolute Truth Absolute Truth is realized in three
phases of understanding namely Brahman or the impersonal all-pervasive spirit Paramatma or the
centralized aspect of the Supreme within the heart of all living entities and Bhagawan or the Supreme
Personality of Godhead Lord Krishna in the Srimad Bhagavatam this conception of the Absolute Truth is
explained thus vadanti tattva vidas tattvam yajnana madhvayam brahmeti paramatmeti bhagavaneti shabdhyate
the Absolute Truth is realized in three phases of understanding by the knower of the Absolute Truth
and all of them are identical such phases of the Absolute Truth are expressed as
Brahman Paramatma and Bhagawan these three Divine aspects can be explained by the example of the
sun which also has three different aspects namely the sunshine the sun's surface and the sun planet
itself one who studies the sunshine only is the preliminary student one who understands the sun's
surface is further advanced and one who can enter into the sun planet is the highest ordinary
students who are satisfied by simply understanding the sunshine its universal
pervasiveness and the glaring effulgence of its impersonal nature may be compared to those who
can realize only the Brahman feature of the Absolute Truth the student who has advanced till further can
know the sun disc which is compared to knowledge of the Paramatma feature of the Absolute Truth and
the student who can enter into the heart of the Sun planet is compared to those who realize the
personal features of the Supreme Absolute Truth therefore the bhaktas or the transcendentalists who
feature of the Absolute Truth are the top most transcendentalists although all students who are
engaged in the study of the Absolute Truth are engaged in the same subject matter the sunshine
the sun disc and the inner affairs of the Sun planet cannot be separated from one another and
yet the students of the three different phases are not in the same category the Sanskrit word Bhagawan
is explained by the great authority Parashara Muni the father of Vyasa Deva the Supreme personality who
all riches all strength all fame all beauty all knowledge and all renunciation is called Bhagawan
there are many persons who are very rich very powerful very beautiful very famous very learned
and very much detached but no one can claim that he possesses all riches all strength Etc entirely
only Krishna can claim this because he is the Supreme personality of Godhead no living entity
including Brahma Lord Shiva or Narayana can possess
as fully as Krishna therefore it is concluded in the Brahma Samhita by Lord Brahma himself that Lord
Krishna is the Supreme personality of Godhead no one is equal to or above him he is the primeval Lord
or Bhagawan known as Govinda and he is the supreme cause of all causes
there are many personalities possessing the qualities of Bhagawan but
Krishna is the Supreme because none can excel him he's a Supreme person and his body is eternal full of
knowledge and Bliss he is the Primeval Lord Govinda and the cause of all causes in the bhagavatham also
there is a list of many incarnations of the Supreme personality of Godhead but Krishna is described as
the original personality of Godhead from whom many many incarnations and personalities of Godhead expand
Krishna is the one who is eternal and full of knowledge and bliss, he is the Supreme personality whom many incarnations and personalities of Godhead expand
इंद्राहारी व्याकुलम लोकम रदयन्ति युगे युगे
All the lists of the incarnations of Godhead submitted herewith are either plenary expansions
or parts of the plenary expansions of the Supreme Godhead,
but Krishna is the Supreme Personality of Godhead Himself.
Therefore, Krishna is the original Supreme Personality of Godhead,
the Absolute Truth, the source of both the Supersoul and the Impersonal Brahman.
In the presence of the Supreme Personality of Godhead,
Arjuna's lamentation for his kinsmen is certainly unbecoming,
and therefore Krishna expressed His surprise with the word,
Such unmanly sentiments were never expected
from a person belonging to the civilized class of men known as Aryans.
The word Aryan is applicable to persons who know the value of life
and have a civilization based on spiritual realization.
Persons who are led by the material conception of life
do not know that the aim of life
is really to achieve the goal of life.
They are led by the realization of the Absolute Truth, Vishnu or Bhagavan,
and they are captivated by the external features of the material world,
and therefore they do not know what liberation is.
Persons who have no knowledge of liberation from material bondage
he was deviating from his prescribed duties by declining to fight.
This act of cowardice is described as befitting the non-Aryans.
Such deviation from duty does not help one in the program,
nor does it even give one the opportunity to become famous in this world.
Lord Krishna did not approve of the so-called compassion of Arjuna for his kinsmen.
Thus ends the Bhakti Dharam Prabhut.
My dear Arjuna, how have these impurities come upon you?
They are not at all befitting a man who knows the progressive values of life.
They do not lead to higher planets, but to infamy.

no, he is writing Bhagavān Uvaj.
So, Krishna is the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
By this writing, it is established, see Bhagavān Uvaj.
He cannot be equal with Arjuna or Sanjaya or anybody else.
He cannot be equal with Arjuna or Sanjaya or anybody else.

Nobody is equal to him. Nobody is higher than him. Everyone is lower.
That is the meaning of Bhagavān. Nobody can claim, I am Bhagavān.
But nowadays there are so many rascals. They are claiming that everyone is Bhagavān.
But Vyāsadeva is mistaken. Actually, these Māyāvādī philosophers, they are so great rascals,
they sometimes say like that, that Vyāsadeva is also mistaken.
They have got the audacity to say, Vyāsadeva is accepted as incarnation of Nārāyaṇa.
Who has given us the Vedic literature. So many books he has given.
The Vedas, the Puranas, Mahābhārata, Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam, Vedānta-Śūtra.
Everything is given by Vyāsadeva in writing. And he is accepted.
He is also Mahābhūnī-kṛte. He is also Vyās-mūṇī. But he is also said Mahābhūnī-kṛte.
There cannot be any mistake in the words of Vyāsadeva.
This is the difficulty. If one does not come through the channel of disciple succession.

Without any result, अनाश्रित कर्म खरम,
कर्म फ़लम्, every action, there is a result. Bad or good, it doesn't matter. There must be some result.
So अनाश्रित कर्म फ़लम्, don't take shelter of the result of your work. Generally we work. If the result is very good, then we like to work.
If the result is not very good,
then we don't like to work. But a devotee should not take... Then you don't like to work. But a devotee should not take...
Why you are moving so fast?
I have got difficulties in my body, so I am still moving.
So by moving you shall be cured?
नाश्रित कर्म फ़लम् कार्यं कर्म कर्म करोते जर।
Do not take shelter of the result of your activity. You must take it as duty.

नौ सन्याशी means he is to work for कृष्णा without taking shelter of the result. It doesn't matter. कृष्णा has order and कृष्णा's representative has order. Therefore I have to do it. कार्यं कर्म करोगे. सा सन्याशी.

He is directly speaking भगवान वाज, the Supreme Personality of Godhead.

Full understanding is Bhagavān. Therefore it is stated here, śrī-bhagavān vāca. There cannot be any mistake that is final. So Bhagavān is

He has decided not to fight with his kinsmen. He has decided not to kill his own man. So from
material point of view, Arjuna is an animal.

So a devotee knows, a Krishna conscious person knows when to kill and when not to kill,
but it is not that because we accept not killing, therefore in every case killing should be stopped.
No. If there is necessity, killing should be accepted. Therefore Arjuna decided not to kill,
not to fight, and Krishna says that this is anārya-duṣṭam, this kind of decision is made by the
uncivilized rasa. Anārya-duṣṭam. Asargaṁ. Akhirti-karam. So many things.
Asargaṁ. Because the aim of human life should be to make progress. That is called Arjuna.
Progressing, marching. Now we have got this human form and knowledge.
Progressing from the lowest species of life in aquatic, then trees, plants, insects, birds,
beasts. Eight million four hundred thousand. Now I have got this civilized form of
body. Then my endeavour should be how to make further progress. This further progress
is described in the Bhagavad-gītā. That you can go to the higher planetary system.

So, I have got this life now.
Let me enjoy my senses to the best capacity.

the senses also will be finished.
